DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not an EML4-ALK gene translocation was identified.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: This gene may play a role in cytoskeletal assembly._This gene is involved in brain development and neuronal specificity._Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer._The movement of a physical object from one place to another. (NCI)_Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: This gene may play a role in cytoskeletal assembly.:This gene is involved in brain development and neuronal specificity.

Concepts.definition: This gene may play a role in cytoskeletal assembly.
This gene is involved in brain development and neuronal specificity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.:The movement of a physical object from one place to another. (NCI):Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: Any transmissible change in the genetic material of an organism, which can result from radiation, viral infection, transposition, treatment with mutagenic chemicals and errors during DNA replication or meiosis. The effects of mutation range from single base changes to loss or gain of complete chromosomes. As many of the simpler alterations to DNA may be repaired, such changes are only heritable once the change is fixed in the DNA by the process of replication. Mutations may be associated with genetic diversity or with pathologies including cancer.
The movement of a physical object from one place to another. (NCI)
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/unknown.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of yes, no, or unknown.
